sections.section_title: Short title, extent and commencement
sections.body: This Act may be called the Antiquities Act, 1975. It extends to the whole of Pakistan. It shall come into force at once.

sections.section_title: Definitions
sections.body: In this Act, unless there is any thing repugnant in the subject of context, definitions of terms such as 'Advisory Committee', 'antiquity', 'dealer', 'Director-General', 'export', 'immovable antiquity', 'national monument', 'owner', 'protected antiquity', and 'rules' are provided.

sections.section_title: Advisory Committee
sections.body: The Federal Government shall constitute an Advisory Committee comprising of members, including one member each from the Senate and the National Assembly.

sections.section_title: Dispute as to whether any product, etc., is an antiquity
sections.body: If any question arises whether any product, object or site is an antiquity, it shall be referred to the Federal Government which shall decide the same after consultation with the Advisory Committee.

sections.section_title: Custody, preservation, etc., of certain antiquities
sections.body: The Director General shall take necessary steps for the custody, preservation and protection of an antiquity of which there is no owner.

sections.section_title: Accidental discovery of antiquity to be reported, to Director-General
sections.body: Whoever discovers any movable antiquity shall inform the Director General within seven days.

sections.section_title: Power of entry, inspection, etc.
sections.body: The Director General may enter into, inspect and examine any premises which may contain an antiquity.

sections.section_title: Acquisition of land containing antiquities
sections.body: If the Federal Government believes that any land contains an antiquity, it may direct the Provincial Government to acquire such land.

sections.section_title: Purchase, taking lease, etc., of antiquity
sections.body: The Director General may purchase, take lease or accept a gift of an antiquity with the previous sanction of the Federal Government.
